revised_title: Frank Dixey: A Life in Geology and Exploration
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of Frank Dixey, a prominent geologist and explorer who contributed significantly to the understanding of geology and hydrogeology in West, Central, and East Africa. Dixey played a crucial role in forming the Directorate of Colonial Geological Surveys and served as its first director. His work in Sierra Leone, as well as other parts of Africa, helped shape the field of geological exploration and laid the foundation for future research in the region.
